snippet.textDisplay: To be honest with you, this is one of the only good remixes in the game.  Many of the rest sort of fall short in my opinion.  Also the localization job is terrible.  The characters have no individuality to them.  They all sound like the same old Japanese man when they talk.
snippet.textOriginal: To be honest with you, this is one of the only good remixes in the game.  Many of the rest sort of fall short in my opinion.  Also the localization job is terrible.  The characters have no individuality to them.  They all sound like the same old Japanese man when they talk.

snippet.textDisplay:
@greenyxi Yeah I know that, I've actually just recently loaded this one onto my PS2, it's the last Wild Arms I havent played.
If you havent checked it yet I highly recommend the tactics spin off they made for the PSP, it's called Wild Arms XF, it's very unorthodox for a tactics RPG but it most definitely is a Wild Arms game.
snippet.textOriginal:
@greenyxi Yeah I know that, I've actually just recently loaded this one onto my PS2, it's the last Wild Arms I havent played.
If you havent checked it yet I highly recommend the tactics spin off they made for the PSP, it's called Wild Arms XF, it's very unorthodox for a tactics RPG but it most definitely is a Wild Arms game.

snippet.textDisplay:
Stats watch: The last Wild Arms track was laid down at number at #908, almost 100 songs ago.  However, the Wild Arms franchise has a grand total of 28 tracks on the list, beating out other such auspicious franchises as Xenosaga, Breath of Fire and Mega Man by 10 tracks.  However, it still lags behind Castlevania, Zelda and Final Fantasy.

PS, this is such a beautiful rendition of this song.  Thanks SD!
snippet.textOriginal:
Stats watch: The last Wild Arms track was laid down at number at #908, almost 100 songs ago.  However, the Wild Arms franchise has a grand total of 28 tracks on the list, beating out other such auspicious franchises as Xenosaga, Breath of Fire and Mega Man by 10 tracks.  However, it still lags behind Castlevania, Zelda and Final Fantasy.

PS, this is such a beautiful rendition of this song.  Thanks SD!
